front.title: Dimensional measurement of nanostructures with scanning electron microscopy

author.organization: Physical Measurement Laboratory (National Institute of Standards and Technology (U.S.))

front.abstract: Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) is widely used for the measurement of dimensions of nanostructures. This document describes the calibration of SEM magnification using the ASTM E766-14 practice with NIST Reference Material (RM) 8820 and the calculation of dimensional uncertainty in the use of the calibrated SEM to measure dimensions of a fabricated nanostructure. The dimensional measurements are part of NIST Special Test 15510S.

seriesInfo.name: NIST special publication; NIST special pub; NIST SP
